page.title: 01AMWELL & STANSTEAD ABBOTTS
page.content: This dominantly rural area, lying in the Metropolitan Green Belt between the Old London Road & the Lea Valley has varied land use. The main rural industry is agriculture. Farms are mainly livestock grazing with arable crops for fodder. Some land is under glass. Farms are under pressure from demands of outdoor recreation. Conflicts arise from over used rights of way, land fragmentation, trespass, vandalism, & rustling. Woodlands are extensive but often run-down through lack of management & Dutch Elm Disease. Aggregate extraction vies with recreation, water supply & agriculture to create landscape despoilation, pollution & traffic hazards. Amenity corridors & the Lea Valley Park provide recreational opportunities. Villages thrive but assume dormitory functions.
